title: Mierlo
text:
Mierlo (population: 10,265) is a <a href="town">town</a> in the southern <a href="Netherlands">Netherlands</a>, in the <a href="Municipalities%20of%20the%20Netherlands">municipality</a> of <a href="Geldrop-Mierlo">Geldrop-Mierlo</a>, <a href="North%20Brabant">North Brabant</a>. Until 2004, it was a separate municipality with an area of .
Mierlo is home to a few interesting buildings, for example the old Council house and the Windmill in the centre of the village. Sports clubs in Mierlo are Mifano and the Hockey Club. Mierlo also has a <a href="zoo">zoo</a> (Dierenrijk), and 2 <a href="hotels">hotels</a> (HIP and 't Anker) and two <a href="campsites">campsites</a> ('t Wolfsven and De Sprink). Just to the south, separated by the <a href="A67%20motorway%20%28Netherlands%29">A67 motorway</a>, lies the <a href="Strabrechtse%20Heide">Strabrechtse Heide</a>.
Mierlo is situated in the urban area of <a href="Eindhoven">Eindhoven</a> and <a href="Helmond">Helmond</a>. But it has many green areas. It lies on the edge of forests, moorlands and fields.
The spoken language is <a href="Meierij">Peelland</a>s (an <a href="East%20Brabantian">East Brabantian</a> dialect, which is very similar to colloquial <a href="Dutch%20language">Dutch</a>).
